translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Gunavatīśrīmahāmāyāṭīkā

translated: In Tibetan: The Commentary on the Glorious Great Magical Illusion

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Lord of the World.🔽For the sake of qualities, you manifest as the families,

analyzed: gang gis yon tan rnams kyi don phyir rigs rnams dang // lha mo rnams dang rigs kyi gtso bo'i skur mdzad cing //
translated: the goddesses, and the forms of the chief of the families.

original: sku yi mtshan ma rjes 'gro de nyid gcig pu yi //
analyzed: sku yi mtshan ma rjes 'gro de nyid gcig pu yi //
translated: Following the signs of your body, that very one

original: rdo rje 'ji pa zhi ba'i don du nges bsten bya //
analyzed: rdo rje 'ji pa zhi ba'i don du nges bsten bya //
translated: is to be served for the sake of the peace of the vajra body.

original: gang zhig tshig tshogs rab tu mang po dpal ldan sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i rgyud //
analyzed: gang zhig tshig tshogs rab tu mang po dpal ldan sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i rgyud //
translated: Those who have a great many collections of words, the glorious Great Magical Illusion Tantra,

original: mdo don ma lus yong slu shes pa'i skye bo ding sang 'ga' tsam srid //
analyzed: mdo don ma lus yong slu shes pa'i skye bo ding sang 'ga' tsam srid //
translated: and know the meaning of the sutra without exception, are rare these days.

original: de bas thos ldan gsal zhing dag pa'i skye bo rnams kyis de yi ni //
analyzed: de bas thos ldan gsal zhing dag pa'i skye bo rnams kyis de yi ni //
translated: Therefore, those who are learned, clear, and pure

original: tshig don so sor shes pa rnyed par bya phyir bdag gis 'grel pa 'di //
analyzed: tshig don so sor shes pa rnyed par bya phyir bdag gis 'grel pa 'di //
translated: In order to acquire the knowledge of the individual words and meanings, I have composed this commentary.

original: skye bo'i 'dod pa thad da rnams la gzigs nas ni //
analyzed: skye bo'i 'dod pa thad da rnams la gzigs nas ni //
translated: Having seen the various desires of beings,

original: bde bar gshegs bas byang chub lam ni sna tshogs gsungs //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs bas byang chub lam ni sna tshogs gsungs //
translated: the Sugata has taught the various paths to enlightenment.

original: 'dod ldan mang du rang nyid 'jug pa srid pas na //
analyzed: 'dod ldan mang du rang nyid 'jug pa srid pas na //
translated: Since it is possible for many desirous ones to engage in this [path] themselves,

original: rnam 'grel yon tan ldan 'di bya bar 'os pa yin //
analyzed: rnam 'grel yon tan ldan 'di bya bar 'os pa yin //
translated: it is fitting to undertake this commentary endowed with good qualities.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: Then, etc.

original: rgyud 'di ni rang gi rgyud ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud 'di ni rang gi rgyud ma yin no //
translated: This tantra is not one's own continuum.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, is it?

original: rgyud gzhan dang 'grel pa ste //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang 'grel pa ste //
translated: It is the other continuum and the commentary.

original: de bas na de nas zhes bya ba'i don rgyud 'di rgyud snga ma la ltos pa'i rjes thogs yin par gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na de nas zhes bya ba'i don rgyud 'di rgyud snga ma la ltos pa'i rjes thogs yin par gsal bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, then clarifies that this tantra is the immediate sequence that depends on the previous tantra.

original: de nyid kyis phyir 'di'i dang por 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la sogs gleng gzhi'i tshig phrad sbyar bar ma mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyis phyir 'di'i dang por 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la sogs gleng gzhi'i tshig phrad sbyar bar ma mdzad de /
translated: For that very reason, he did not use the introductory words Thus have I heard, etc. at the beginning of this [tantra],

original: snga ma nyid la sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma nyid la sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: because they were already used in the previous [tantra].

original: dper na dpal rdor rje rtse mo la sogs pa'i rgyud bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dpal rdor rje rtse mo la sogs pa'i rgyud bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the tantra of the glorious Vajraśekhara.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgras gang gi phyir mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba rnams 'di nyid kyis myur du byang bsgrub pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgras gang gi phyir mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba rnams 'di nyid kyis myur du byang bsgrub pa'i phyir te //
translated: After means that because those who delight in the concise will quickly accomplish this,

original: de nas rab tu bshad par bya //
analyzed: de nas rab tu bshad par bya //
translated: then it should be fully explained.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar te //
translated: This is connected.

original: rab tu rnam par phye ste bshad pa ni rab tu bshad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par phye ste bshad pa ni rab tu bshad par bya ba'o //
translated: Fully explained means should be fully explained.

original: rgyud ces bya ba ni rab tu rgyas pa ste //
analyzed: rgyud ces bya ba ni rab tu rgyas pa ste //
translated: Tantra means extensive.

original: rgyu'i rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud de rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud de rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three types: the cause tantra, the result tantra, and the method tantra.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i byang chub kyi sems de ni rgyud des bon ni @181a * //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i byang chub kyi sems de ni rgyud des bon ni @181a * //
translated: Among those, the naturally luminous, beginningless and endless bodhicitta is the seed of the tantra.

original: de gang gi sa bon zhe na /🔽byang chub kyi ste /
analyzed: de gang gi sa bon zhe na / byang chub kyi ste /
translated: What is the seed of that?🔽 It is the seed of enlightenment.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi'o //
translated: It is the seed of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: de nyid ni bla na med pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni bla na med pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'o //
translated: That itself is the result because it is the unsurpassed result.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'i sems glo bur gyi sgrib pa thams cad zad pas rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos sku ste /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'i sems glo bur gyi sgrib pa thams cad zad pas rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos sku ste /
translated: Moreover, the Dharma Body of the Buddhas is characterized by purity, because the mind, which is naturally radiant, is exhausted of all adventitious obscurations.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus bsdus pa'i yon tan mtha' yas pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus bsdus pa'i yon tan mtha' yas pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the basis of the infinite qualities of the Buddhas, which are included in the Enjoyment Body and the Emanation Body.

original: de nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub chos kyi sku ste /
translated: That itself is the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Dharma Body.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: It is the state of the Great Vajra Holder.

original: rgyu de las de'i 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa ni thabs te /
analyzed: rgyu de las de'i 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa ni thabs te /
translated: The means of perfecting that result from that cause is the method.

original: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du sgrub pa'i lam 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa chen po la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du sgrub pa'i lam 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in the Mahayana of the Perfection Vehicle, it is the path of practice together with its retinue that is accomplished by the Bodhisattvas over three incalculable aeons.

original: gsang sngags kyi theg pa la ni byang chub kyi lam ni shin tu rgya chen po de nyid mdor bsdus pa'i rang bzhin shin tu myur ba dang / shin tu bde par byang chub sgrub pa'i thabs dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i lam 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi theg pa la ni byang chub kyi lam ni shin tu rgya chen po de nyid mdor bsdus pa'i rang bzhin shin tu myur ba dang / shin tu bde par byang chub sgrub pa'i thabs dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i lam 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: In the vehicle of mantra, the path to enlightenment is extremely vast, and the means of accomplishing enlightenment is extremely swift and extremely blissful, in the nature of a summary of that very [path]. It is the path together with its retinue, such as the maṇḍala wheel.

original: rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / thabs de ngag gi dbang du byas nas gang bstan pa de dag ni rgyas pa ste go rims bzhin du rgyu'i rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud de /
analyzed: rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / thabs de ngag gi dbang du byas nas gang bstan pa de dag ni rgyas pa ste go rims bzhin du rgyu'i rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud de /
translated: The cause, the result, and the method, which are taught in terms of speech, are extensive. They are, respectively, the cause tantra, the result tantra, and the method tantra.

original: rgyud rnam pa gsum po 'di dag rab tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud rnam pa gsum po 'di dag rab tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: These three types of tantra should be fully explained.

original: 'o na rgyud de'i ming ci zhe na /🔽mchog tu gsang ba zhes pa'i sgra ni zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / grags pa la 'jug pa ste ;
analyzed: 'o na rgyud de'i ming ci zhe na / mchog tu gsang ba zhes pa'i sgra ni zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / grags pa la 'jug pa ste ;
translated: Now, what is the name of that tantra?🔽The term supreme secret refers to inexhaustibility and fame.

original: mchog tu gsang ba zhes bya ba'i ming can du grags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba zhes bya ba'i ming can du grags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means renowned as having the name Supreme Secret.

original: gang rnams kyis mchog tu gsang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang rnams kyis mchog tu gsang ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that is supremely secret?

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis //
translated: Of the Vajra dakinis.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽This is to be applied to the meaning of worship, up to the end of the verse:

original: 'di ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ma lus pa rnams kyi mchog tu gsang ba'i rgyud ces bya ba'i bar du mchod pa'i don dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ma lus pa rnams kyi mchog tu gsang ba'i rgyud ces bya ba'i bar du mchod pa'i don dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is the supreme secret tantra of all the Vajra dakinis.

original: mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba la //
translated: As for the dakinis,

original: de ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba ste /
translated: they are those who go in the sky.

original: ae aar byas nas dha gsum pa'i don du sbyar bas dhas nam mkha' la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ae aar byas nas dha gsum pa'i don du sbyar bas dhas nam mkha' la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having made the e and the a, they are applied to the meaning of the third d, so the d means “those who go in the sky.”

original: aa ka aa ga ni gya gyur 'gro pa'o //
analyzed: aa ka aa ga ni gya gyur 'gro pa'o //
translated: The a ka a ga means “those who go crookedly.”

original: 'dir thams cad du 'gro ba ni gya gyur @181b 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad du 'gro ba ni gya gyur @181b 'gro ba'o //
translated: Here, “all-going” means “going crookedly.”

original: d'a sa gya gyur 'gro ba'i ngang tshul gang rnams la yod pa de dag ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba rnams te /
analyzed: d'a sa gya gyur 'gro ba'i ngang tshul gang rnams la yod pa de dag ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba rnams te /
translated: Those who have the nature of going crookedly are the dakinis,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis bye ba phrag brgya stong gi skus cig car thams cad du 'gro ba mi rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis bye ba phrag brgya stong gi skus cig car thams cad du 'gro ba mi rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: those who go everywhere at once with a body of a hundred thousand myriads of magical emanations. This is the meaning of “those who go in the sky.”

original: de skad du yang //
analyzed: de skad du yang //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de ni nam mkhar 'gro ma zhes //
analyzed: de ni nam mkhar 'gro ma zhes //
translated: She is not called “one who goes in the sky”

original: khams las 'dir ni rnam par brtag / nam mkha' kun du rgyu grub pas /🔽mkha' 'gro ma zhes brdar btags so //
analyzed: khams las 'dir ni rnam par brtag / nam mkha' kun du rgyu grub pas / mkha' 'gro ma zhes brdar btags so //
translated: because of the element here, but because of the establishment of the sky-farer.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: She is called “sky-farer” by convention.

original: rdo rje'i sgra smos pa ni phyi rol gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnam par gcad pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sgra smos pa ni phyi rol gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnam par gcad pa'i don to //
translated: The mention of “vajra” is for the purpose of excluding external sky-farers.

original: rdo rje yang yin la mkha' 'gro ma yang yin pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje yang yin la mkha' 'gro ma yang yin pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams te /
translated: They are vajra-sky-farers because they are both vajra and sky-farers,

original: spros pa med pa'i ye shes las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i ye shes las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that they arise from non-conceptual wisdom.

original: de rnams ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: de rnams ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na //
translated: What are they like?

original: gsang ba'i dbang phyug ma zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang phyug ma zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that they are “secret lords.”

original: 'dir rigs ldan ni gsang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dir rigs ldan ni gsang ba yin la /
translated: Here, the lord is secret.

original: de rnams de la 'byin pa da nga yang dag par sdud par byed pas na dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: de rnams de la 'byin pa da nga yang dag par sdud par byed pas na dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: They are lords because they emit and gather that into themselves.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dbang mo ni sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dbang mo ni sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: Among them, the lord of the Tathagata family is the Buddha-dakini.

original: rdo rje'i rigs kyi ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs kyi ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The Vajra family is Vajraḍāka.

original: nor bu'i rigs kyi ni rin chen mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs kyi ni rin chen mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The Jewel family is Ratnaḍāka.

original: padma'i rigs kyi ni padma mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi ni padma mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The Lotus family is Padmaḍāka.

original: las kyi rigs kyi dbang mo'i ni sna tshogs mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: las kyi rigs kyi dbang mo'i ni sna tshogs mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The Action family is Viśvaḍāka.

original: de rnams kyi yang dbang mo ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang dbang mo ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo ste /
translated: And of those, the queen is Mahāmāyā.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni gsang ba las kyang shin tu gsang ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni gsang ba las kyang shin tu gsang ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because this is more secret than secret,

original: mchog tu gsang ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba'o //
translated: it is the supreme secret.

original: de rjod par byed pa'i tshig la yang de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa'i tshig la yang de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The words that express that are also called that.

original: rol snyed ma phrogs pa'i snyan ngag bzhin no //
analyzed: rol snyed ma phrogs pa'i snyan ngag bzhin no //
translated: Like a song that is not stolen by the gods.

original: ming 'di nyid kyi don bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: ming 'di nyid kyi don bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to teach the meaning of this very name,

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽tshangs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / tshangs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: he says “that” and so forth.🔽Brahma is

original: bharma ni ta ste rgan po yin la /
analyzed: bharma ni ta ste rgan po yin la /
translated: an old man.

original: ma na ni rkyen yin te /
analyzed: ma na ni rkyen yin te /
translated: Mana is a condition.

original: yi ge rnam par bsgyur ba'i nges pa'i tshig tu byas pas tshangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge rnam par bsgyur ba'i nges pa'i tshig tu byas pas tshangs par 'gyur te /
translated: The word brahma is derived from the root brh, to grow, because it causes growth.

original: 'dir 'jig rten thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pas thams cad las rgan pas na tshangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pas thams cad las rgan pas na tshangs pa ste /
translated: Brahma is the teacher of the entire world, and so is the oldest of all.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus bsdus pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus bsdus pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The Tathagatas are included in the Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body.

original: de rnams kyi sgo nga ni skye gnas te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgo nga ni skye gnas te /
translated: Their egg is the place of birth,

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means the Reality Body.

original: yang na khyad par du gyur pa'i thar pa ni tshangs pa @182a * //
analyzed: yang na khyad par du gyur pa'i thar pa ni tshangs pa @182a * //
translated: Or else, Brahma is the special liberation,

original: yin la // sku nyid kyi skye gnas yin pa'i phyir sgo nga yang yin pas tshangs sgong ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: yin la // sku nyid kyi skye gnas yin pa'i phyir sgo nga yang yin pas tshangs sgong ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: and since the Body is the place of birth, it is the egg of Brahma, which is the Reality Body.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rnams kyi sems can gyi 'jig rten rnams ni rgyu pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rnams kyi sems can gyi 'jig rten rnams ni rgyu pa'o //
translated: Here, the world of sentient beings in the pure Buddha lands is the moving world.

original: de rnams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin pa de ni 'dir mi rgyu ma'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin pa de ni 'dir mi rgyu ma'o //
translated: The physical world of those sentient beings is the unmoving world.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig 'jug pas na /
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig 'jug pas na /
translated: Because they move together with those sentient beings,

original: rgyu mi rgyu bcas tshangs sgo nga ste /
analyzed: rgyu mi rgyu bcas tshangs sgo nga ste /
translated: The cause and the non-cause are the Brahma-egg.

original: de dag la gang gis khyab pa zhes bya bar 'brel te /
analyzed: de dag la gang gis khyab pa zhes bya bar 'brel te /
translated: They are pervaded by him, is the connection.

original: ma lus zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis de dag kun la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma lus zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis de dag kun la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “all of them” is that all of the Tathagatas are in all of them.

original: de ltar ji ltar tshangs pa'i sgo nga la des khyab ce na /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar tshangs pa'i sgo nga la des khyab ce na /
translated: In what way is the Brahma-egg pervaded by him?

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshangs pa'i sgo nga ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshangs pa'i sgo nga ste /
translated: Because the Brahma-egg of all Buddhas is his,

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is his nature.

original: ci'i phyir rgyu pa dang mi rgyu ba'i 'jig rten la des khyab pa ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu pa dang mi rgyu ba'i 'jig rten la des khyab pa ce na /
translated: In what way is the world of the moving and unmoving pervaded by him?

analyzed: don du snang ba rab tu skye // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Arises as an image of an object.

original: bag chags kyis dkrugs pa ni bag chags kyis brtson zhing bslad pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyis dkrugs pa ni bag chags kyis brtson zhing bslad pa'o //
translated: “Disturbed by the instincts” means agitated and polluted by the instincts.

original: chos thams cad sems tsam yin mod /
analyzed: chos thams cad sems tsam yin mod /
translated: “All things are mind only” is a statement of the ultimate reality.

original: yang de rang bzhin gyis snang zhing 'od gsal pa'i phyir yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de rang bzhin gyis snang zhing 'od gsal pa'i phyir yin zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is because the mind is luminous by nature,

original: gdod nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gdod nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the verse says “Primordial purity,” and so on.

original: gdod nas ni thog ma med pa nyid nas so //
analyzed: gdod nas ni thog ma med pa nyid nas so //
translated: “Primordial” means from beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa nyid nas sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid nas sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pas na dag pa'o //
translated: It is “pure” because it is uncontaminated by any obscurations from beginningless time.

original: sgrib pa rnams kyi bag chags med pas na rnyog pa med pa'o //🔽cing zhes bya ba ni gang gi @184a * //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams kyi bag chags med pas na rnyog pa med pa'o // cing zhes bya ba ni gang gi @184a * //
translated: It is “unpolluted” because it is free of the instincts for the obscurations.

original: phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “And” means “because.”

original: gang go phyir gdon ma nas dag pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis snang la rnyog pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'o //
analyzed: gang go phyir gdon ma nas dag pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis snang la rnyog pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'o //
translated: It is naturally luminous because it is pure by nature, and because it is naturally radiant, being unclouded.

original: 'o na dri ma rnams kyang yod la de'i bag chags rnams kyang yod bzhin du ci'i phyir dag pa dang rnyog pa med ce na /
analyzed: 'o na dri ma rnams kyang yod la de'i bag chags rnams kyang yod bzhin du ci'i phyir dag pa dang rnyog pa med ce na /
translated: But if there are still defilements and their instincts, how can it be pure and unclouded?

original: de dag gi rang bzhin de ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin de ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because their nature is not that.

original: nam mkha' la rdul dang / du ba dang / khug rna la sogs pa bzhin du dri ma rnams de la glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la rdul dang / du ba dang / khug rna la sogs pa bzhin du dri ma rnams de la glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Defilements are adventitious to it, like dust, smoke, clouds, etc., to the sky.

original: de bas na chos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the dharmas are naturally luminous.

original: ci ste de ltar ma gyur na 'ga' yang byang chub thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar ma gyur na 'ga' yang byang chub thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, no one would attain enlightenment,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin dri mar gyur na sems yod pa de zad par 'gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin dri mar gyur na sems yod pa de zad par 'gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be impossible for the extinction of the existent mind to be the nature of the mind.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin kyis  'od gsal ba'i sems nyid byang chub kyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin kyis  'od gsal ba'i sems nyid byang chub kyi rgyu yin la /
translated: Therefore, the naturally luminous mind itself is the cause of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: It is the result of enlightenment.

original: byang chub de yang bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad zad pas sems kyi rgyud shin tu rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub de yang bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad zad pas sems kyi rgyud shin tu rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: That enlightenment is the extremely pure continuum of mind, due to the exhaustion of all obscurations together with their traces.

original: de nyid ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: That itself is the Dharma Body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i skus bsdus pa'i chos rnams kyi gzhi dang gnas su gyur pas na sku'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i skus bsdus pa'i chos rnams kyi gzhi dang gnas su gyur pas na sku'o //
translated: It is the body because it is the basis and foundation of the dharmas subsumed by the Enjoyment and Transformation Bodies.

original: de la chos kyi sku nyid kyis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams rang byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku nyid kyis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams rang byung ba yin te /
translated: In that regard, the Buddhas, the Exalted Ones, are self-originated by means of the Dharma Body,

original: sgrib pa thams cad zad pas rang nyid 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad zad pas rang nyid 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur pa ste /
translated: because all obscurations are exhausted, they become only self-existent,

original: rang gi rang bzhin kho na snang ngo zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin kho na snang ngo zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: meaning that only their intrinsic nature appears.

original: sku gsum gyis ni ye shes lnga por 'gyur te /
analyzed: sku gsum gyis ni ye shes lnga por 'gyur te /
translated: By means of the three Bodies, there are the five Gnoses.

original: de la de dag gi ye shes lnga ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la de dag gi ye shes lnga ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The five gnoses of those buddhas are the mirror-like gnosis, the gnosis of equality, the individually discerning gnosis, the allaccomplishing gnosis, and the gnosis of the ultimate realm.

original: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni me long dri ma med pa ltar dag cing mtha' med la rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni me long dri ma med pa ltar dag cing mtha' med la rtag pa ste /
translated: The mirror-like gnosis is pure like a stainless mirror, limitless, and constant.

original: ye shes bar ma gsum gyi gnas su gyur pa dang / ye shes gzhan thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: ye shes bar ma gsum gyi gnas su gyur pa dang / ye shes gzhan thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i gnas yin la /
translated: It is the basis of the three intermediate gnoses and the basis for the arising of the reflections of all other gnoses.

original: gzugs brnyan gang zhig shar bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad gzigs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gang zhig shar bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad gzigs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The reflections that arise in it are the means by which the tathāgatas see all phenomena in all their aspects.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni rtag tu byams pa chen po dang snying @184b rje chen po dang mtshungs par ldan pas sems can thams cad bdag nyid khyad par med par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni rtag tu byams pa chen po dang snying @184b rje chen po dang mtshungs par ldan pas sems can thams cad bdag nyid khyad par med par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of equality is the knowledge that all sentient beings are no different from oneself, because it is always accompanied by great love and great compassion.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du bdag nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ston par mdzad cing /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du bdag nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ston par mdzad cing /
translated: The wisdom of individual investigation is the knowledge that displays all the perfections of oneself in the circle of the assembly, because it is the basis of all the concentrations and powers of retention and is unobstructed with regard to all that is to be known.

original: chos kyi char chen po 'bebs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi char chen po 'bebs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: It causes the great rain of the Dharma to fall.

original: ye shes gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa thams cad du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sprul pa rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa de ni de rnams kyi bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so
analyzed: ye shes gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa thams cad du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sprul pa rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa de ni de rnams kyi bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so
translated: The wisdom of accomplishment of what is to be done is the wisdom by which the Tathagatas accomplish the aims of sentient beings in infinite world-realms through the emanations of body, speech, and mind.

original: // ye shes gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid shin du rnam par ngag pa la gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: // ye shes gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid shin du rnam par ngag pa la gzigs pa ste /
translated: The wisdom by which the Tathagatas see the suchness of all phenomena as extremely pure.

original: mtshan ma'i dri ma thams cad shin tu mi snang pas de tsam du gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i dri ma thams cad shin tu mi snang pas de tsam du gzigs pa ste /
translated: Since all the stains of signs do not appear at all, it is seen as just that.

original: de ni de rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de ni de rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the extremely pure dharmadhatu wisdom of the Tathagatas.

original: de la ye shes dang po gsum ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes dang po gsum ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Among those, the first three wisdoms are the enjoyment body.

original: bzhi pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The fourth is the emanation body.

original: lnga pa ni chos kyi sku'o phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni chos kyi sku'o phyogs gcig ste /
translated: The fifth is the dharma body.

original: rang byung yang yin la ye shes lnga pa yang yin pas de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rang byung yang yin la ye shes lnga pa yang yin pas de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: It is called “self-arisen” because it is a self-arisen, and it is called “wisdom” because it is the fifth wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called “the Tathagatas” because it is the meaning of the Tathagatas.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rgyu de las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rgyu de las so //
translated: “From that” means from the cause of natural luminosity.

original: thabs brjod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa de rnams la thabs gtso bor gyur par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thabs brjod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa de rnams la thabs gtso bor gyur par bstan pa ste /
translated: The chapter called “The Expression of Methods” is the teaching of the methods that are foremost among those that are results.

original: 'di ltar rgyu yod du zin kyang thabs ma rtogs par 'bras bur 'gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu yod du zin kyang thabs ma rtogs par 'bras bur 'gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, even if there is a cause, without the realization of the method, there is no result.

original: rgyu ni thog ma med pa'i dus can yin pas thams cad thog ma nyid nas byang chub par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni thog ma med pa'i dus can yin pas thams cad thog ma nyid nas byang chub par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause has been beginningless since the beginning, it would follow that everything would be enlightened from the very beginning.

original: de bas na thabs gtso bor gyur par bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na thabs gtso bor gyur par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the method is taught to be foremost.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated with “the yoginīs,” and so on.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams ni mkha' 'gro ma lnga'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams ni mkha' 'gro ma lnga'o //
translated: The yoginīs are the five ḍākinīs.

original: sbyor ba'i ma zhes bya ba ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo'o//
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ma zhes bya ba ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo'o//
translated: The “mother of union” is Mahāmāyā.

original: khams gsum po ni ma lus kun //
analyzed: khams gsum po ni ma lus kun //
translated: All of the three realms

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa thams cad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa thams cad de /
translated: means all three realms.

original: de dag las yang dag par byung ba ni rigs kyi dbang po rnams dang rigs rnams so //
analyzed: de dag las yang dag par byung ba ni rigs kyi dbang po rnams dang rigs rnams so //
translated: Those that arise from them are the lords of the families and the families.

original: ci'i phyir de dag khams gsum pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag khams gsum pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they the three realms?

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsang ba gsum gyi rdo rje'i khams @185a * //🔽su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsang ba gsum gyi rdo rje'i khams @185a * // su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are included in the vajra realm of the three secrets of the Tathagatas.

original: de'i phyir de dag thabs yin zhe na /🔽byang chub kyi snod du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yod pa la 'di rnams nyid bsgom pa dang bzlas pa 'khor dang bcas pas myur du byang chub thob par byed la de thob nas kyang de dag nyid longs spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag thabs yin zhe na / byang chub kyi snod du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yod pa la 'di rnams nyid bsgom pa dang bzlas pa 'khor dang bcas pas myur du byang chub thob par byed la de thob nas kyang de dag nyid longs spyod pa dang /
translated: Why are they the means?

original: sprul pa'i skus bsdus pa rnams kyis gzhan rnams snod ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub rnam pa gsum thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma lus lus pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i skus bsdus pa rnams kyis gzhan rnams snod ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub rnam pa gsum thob par byed pa'i phyir ro // ma lus lus pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they quickly cause the attainment of enlightenment by those who have the perfection of the cause, the characteristic of being a vessel for enlightenment, through the practice and repetition of these, along with their retinue. And having attained that, they cause others to attain the three kinds of enlightenment, in accordance with their vessels, through those very means, and through the means of the Enjoyment Body and Emanation Body.

original: ma lus pa ni rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa phung po gsum po de dag las phung po gcig kyang dor ba med pa'o//
analyzed: ma lus pa ni rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa phung po gsum po de dag las phung po gcig kyang dor ba med pa'o//
translated: Without exception means that not even one of those three aggregates, such as the Yoginis, is left out.

original: lus la med pa ni phung po gcig gis yang lha gcig kyang dor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: lus la med pa ni phung po gcig gis yang lha gcig kyang dor ba med pa ste /
translated: The non-existence of the body is the non-abandonment of even one god by one aggregate.

original: ma lus pa yang de yin la lus pa med pa yang de yin pas de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa yang de yin la lus pa med pa yang de yin pas de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since they are all and also without remainder, they are so called.

original: grub cing zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rnam par shes pa tsam gyis sgrub pa po rnams la lam dang 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: grub cing zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rnam par shes pa tsam gyis sgrub pa po rnams la lam dang 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is that which is accomplished by mere consciousness, the natural perfection of the path and result for the adepts.

original: ci'i byir 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i byir 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is it accomplished?

original: sgyu mas kun la rnam par rol pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgyu mas kun la rnam par rol pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the play in all by means of the illusion.

original: lam dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs 'di dag thams cad sgyu 'phrul chen mo kho na la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs 'di dag thams cad sgyu 'phrul chen mo kho na la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all these situations of the path and result, etc. are dependent on the Great Illusion alone.

original: 'jig rten gsum bsgrub pa ces gang sngar bstan pa de'i nye bar bstan pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum bsgrub pa ces gang sngar bstan pa de'i nye bar bstan pa mdzad nas /
translated: Having taught the accomplishment of the three worlds as previously explained,

original: 'dod pa thams cad rab star ba //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad rab star ba //
translated: he teaches the accomplishment of all desires

original: zhes bya ba gang sngar bstan pa de nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang sngar bstan pa de nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: as previously explained.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: All the Buddhas and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: All the Buddhas are the Buddhas.

original: 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gam bdag gi don gyi phyir dgug pa'o //
analyzed: 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gam bdag gi don gyi phyir dgug pa'o //
translated: Stealing means summoning for the sake of oneself or one's own.

original: lha mchog ni lha'i gtso bo rnams te /
analyzed: lha mchog ni lha'i gtso bo rnams te /
translated: The supreme gods are the chief gods.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
translated: Indra and so forth.

original: spyod ces bya ba ni bkug nas nye par spyod pa'i //
analyzed: spyod ces bya ba ni bkug nas nye par spyod pa'i //
translated: Practice means, having summoned, one practices in close proximity.

original: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Yoga is meditative concentration.

original: de'i dbang phyug ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa dag la dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa dag la dbang thob pa'o //
translated: The lord of that is the attainment of power over those who possess meditative equipoise.

original: mig 'phrul ni yod pa dang med pa'i dmag la sogs pa ji ltar rigs par sprul te ston pa dang / mi snang bar yang byed pa'o //🔽rmongs pa ni brgyal pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mig 'phrul ni yod pa dang med pa'i dmag la sogs pa ji ltar rigs par sprul te ston pa dang / mi snang bar yang byed pa'o // rmongs pa ni brgyal pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Illusion means manifesting, as appropriate, an existent or nonexistent army and so forth, and also becoming invisible.🔽Delusion is the state of fainting.

original: rengs pa ni mi g-yo bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: rengs pa ni mi g-yo bar byas pa'o //
translated: Paralysis is making [the victim] immobile.

original: bskrad pa ni gnas nas g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa ni gnas nas g-yo ba'o //
translated: Expelling is moving [the victim] from his place.

original: bsad pa ni dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la shin tu gnod par byed pa rnams @185b gzhom pa'o //
analyzed: bsad pa ni dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la shin tu gnod par byed pa rnams @185b gzhom pa'o //
translated: Killing is the destruction of those who do great harm to the Three Jewels, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni yan lag nyams pa dang / rims dang / srin pos bzung ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni yan lag nyams pa dang / rims dang / srin pos bzung ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words “etc.” include those whose limbs are impaired, those who are feverish, and those who are possessed by rākṣasas.

original: dbang ni dbang du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbang ni dbang du gyur pa ste /
translated: Power is the power of mastery.

original: 'di dbang du byed pa'i las la dbang zhes bya'o /
analyzed: 'di dbang du byed pa'i las la dbang zhes bya'o /
translated: This is called “mastery” because it is the mastery of the action of summoning.

original: dgug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dgug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Summoning is of two kinds:

original: rkang pas dgug pa dang / gong bur dgag pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pas dgug pa dang / gong bur dgag pa'o //
translated: summoning by the feet and summoning by the head.

original: dang po ni sa las 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni sa las 'ong ba'o //
translated: The first is coming from the earth.

original: gnyis pa ni nam mkha' las 'ong pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nam mkha' las 'ong pa'o //
translated: The second is coming from the sky.

original: las rnams ni dbang dang dgug pa'i las gsum mo //
analyzed: las rnams ni dbang dang dgug pa'i las gsum mo //
translated: The actions are the three actions of mastery and summoning.

original: gzhan gyi grong na gzhan gyi lus la 'jug pa'o /
analyzed: gzhan gyi grong na gzhan gyi lus la 'jug pa'o /
translated: Entering another’s body in another’s village, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gong du 'pho ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gong du 'pho ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words “etc.” include ascending, etc.

original: bya ba ni gzhan gyi grong la sogs pa la de dag nyams su blang pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni gzhan gyi grong la sogs pa la de dag nyams su blang pa'o //
translated: The action is the practice of those in another’s village, etc.

original: mi snang pa ni mi mthong par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi snang pa ni mi mthong par bya ba'o //
translated: Invisibility is making oneself invisible.

original: zhe 'gros pa ni phan tshun chags pa dang ldan pa dag kyang sdang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhe 'gros pa ni phan tshun chags pa dang ldan pa dag kyang sdang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The crooked are those who are attached to each other, and are to be hated.

original: rmugs pa ni lkugs pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni lkugs pa'o //
translated: The dumb are those who are mute.

original: sa 'og 'gro ba ni lha ma yin gyi sgor 'jug pa'o //🔽rigs 'dzin 'khor los sgyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa 'og 'gro ba ni lha ma yin gyi sgor 'jug pa'o // rigs 'dzin 'khor los sgyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The underworld is the entrance to the door of the demigods.🔽The wheel-turning is the power to destroy and protect the vidyadharas.

original: rig 'dzin rnams tshar bcad pa dang rjes su gzung ba'i nus ba can de ni 'khor los sgyur ba ste de'i dngos ni de nyid do //
analyzed: rig 'dzin rnams tshar bcad pa dang rjes su gzung ba'i nus ba can de ni 'khor los sgyur ba ste de'i dngos ni de nyid do //
translated: The wheel-turning is the power to destroy and protect the vidyadharas, and that is its reality.

original: 'chi ba med pa dang / rgas pa med pa dang / na ba med pa gsum pa ni go sla ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa dang / rgas pa med pa dang / na ba med pa gsum pa ni go sla ste /
translated: The three - immortality, agelessness, and sickness - are easy to understand.

original: na pa med pa nyid dang zhes dang gi don shes par bya ste /
analyzed: na pa med pa nyid dang zhes dang gi don shes par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of and should be known as and sickness-lessness.

original: rmongs pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad rnal 'byor ma sgyu ma'i rigs 'di yis bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad rnal 'byor ma sgyu ma'i rigs 'di yis bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: All of those, delusion and so forth, are to be done by this family of the yoginis' illusion, is the remainder.

original: sgyu ma zhes bya ba ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo ste de nyid ni rig pa'i //
analyzed: sgyu ma zhes bya ba ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo ste de nyid ni rig pa'i //
translated: The illusion is the Great Illusion, and that itself is the knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ro gcig tu sbyor bas rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ro gcig tu sbyor bas rnal 'byor te /
translated: It is yoga because it is the union of all the qualities of the Buddha into one taste.

original: rnal 'byor yang yin la sgyu ma'i rig pa yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor yang yin la sgyu ma'i rig pa yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “the knowledge of illusory yoga” because it is both a yoga and the knowledge of illusion.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad las 'phrog pa la sogs pa'i las kyi sbyor ba kha cig ni rgyud 'di nyid las brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad las 'phrog pa la sogs pa'i las kyi sbyor ba kha cig ni rgyud 'di nyid las brjod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, some of the practices such as “stealing from all the Buddhas” are described in this very tantra.

original: kha cig ni rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs te blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs te blta bar bya'o //
translated: Some should be understood by following other tantras.

original: gang zhig rnam par shes pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni nyams su blangs pa tsam mo zhes bya ba la nyams su blang ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par shes pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni nyams su blangs pa tsam mo zhes bya ba la nyams su blang ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: “ Whoever, by mere consciousness” means by mere practice. In order to teach that practice, he says:

original: sngags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sngags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “mantra” and so on.

original: sngags ni sngags kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sngags ni sngags kyi tshogs so //
translated: “ Mantra” is a collection of mantras.

original: yi ge'i gzugs ni yi ge las skyes pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: yi ge'i gzugs ni yi ge las skyes pa'i gzugs te /
translated: “ Syllable-form” is the form born from the syllables.

original: sngags dang yi ge'i gzugs de dag gi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngags dang yi ge'i gzugs de dag gi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are the forms of the mantras and syllables.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni sgrub po rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni sgrub po rnams so //
translated: “ Yogins” are the adepts.

original: rnam par rol pa ni las la sogs @186a * //
analyzed: rnam par rol pa ni las la sogs @186a * //
translated: Play is the activity of the buddhas.🔽

original: pa grub pa'i rnam pa rtse pa'o //
analyzed: pa grub pa'i rnam pa rtse pa'o //
translated: Play is the peak of the form of accomplishment of action and so forth.

original: sngags ji ltar nyams su blang zhe na /
analyzed: sngags ji ltar nyams su blang zhe na /
translated: How is the mantra to be practiced?

original: bklag pa dang ni bsam pa dang // zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bklag pa dang ni bsam pa dang // zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “Reciting and contemplating,”🔽and so forth.

original: bklag pa ni ngag gi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: bklag pa ni ngag gi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Reciting is the recitation of the voice.

original: bsam pa ni yid kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni yid kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Contemplating is the recitation of the mind.

original: yi ge'i gzugs nyid ji ltar nyams su blang zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge'i gzugs nyid ji ltar nyams su blang zhe na /
translated: How is the form of the syllables to be practiced?

original: bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “Meditating,” and so forth.

original: bsgoms pa ni yid kyis rnam pa rgyun chags su 'jug pas lta ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa ni yid kyis rnam pa rgyun chags su 'jug pas lta ba'o //
translated: Meditating is seeing with the mind by continuously engaging in the aspect.

original: ting 'dzin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la sems gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting 'dzin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la sems gnas pa'o //
translated: Samādhi is the mind abiding on that very object.

original: bklags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji ltar nyams su blangs pa'i 'bras bu ston pa yin te /
analyzed: bklags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji ltar nyams su blangs pa'i 'bras bu ston pa yin te /
translated: “Reciting,” and so forth, teaches the result of practice.

original: bklags pa zhes bya ba ni bzlas brjod do //
analyzed: bklags pa zhes bya ba ni bzlas brjod do //
translated: Reciting is recitation.

original: rig pa ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo'o //
translated: Vidyā is Mahāmāya.

original: byed pa zhes bya ba ni dgug pa la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa zhes bya ba ni dgug pa la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed pa'o //
translated: Doing is performing all activities such as summoning.

original: rig pa'i sgra gnyis pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ston to //
analyzed: rig pa'i sgra gnyis pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ston to //
translated: The second instance of the word “knowledge” indicates the wisdom that arises from meditation.

original: sang sku'i bsgom pa rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: sang sku'i bsgom pa rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the body is complete.

original: rang gi lha'i gzugs kyis rnam par bdag nyid gsa' par blta'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i gzugs kyis rnam par bdag nyid gsa' par blta'o //
translated: One should see oneself as having the form of one’s deity.

original: dngos grub byed pa ni des sgrub pa po phyag rgya chen por sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub byed pa ni des sgrub pa po phyag rgya chen por sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of power is the accomplishment of the practitioner as a great seal.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni las rnams kyang sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni las rnams kyang sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: “ Whatever” means that one should also accomplish the activities.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni rang gi lha'i gzugs su rdzogs par byas la rang ngam gzhan gyis mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni rang gi lha'i gzugs su rdzogs par byas la rang ngam gzhan gyis mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the great seal is the completion of one’s own form as a deity, which is seen by oneself or another.

original: bde blag tu nyams su blang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde blag tu nyams su blang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the easy practice,

original: brtul zhugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brtul zhugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “without observances,” and so on.

original: 'dir med ces bya ba'i sgras ni byed pa zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbyar te bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir med ces bya ba'i sgras ni byed pa zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbyar te bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the word “without” is connected with the previous word “observances,” and the meaning is “not to be observed.”

original: brtul zhugs ni khrus gsum dang / gos gsum brje ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni khrus gsum dang / gos gsum brje ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Observances are the three baths, the three changes of clothes, and so on.

original: dka' thub ni sngo tshod dang / sred za ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub ni sngo tshod dang / sred za ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Austerity is eating vegetables, eating once a day, and so on.

original: dka' spyod ni ba bsten par dka' ba ste 'di ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dka' spyod ni ba bsten par dka' ba ste 'di ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Austerity is difficult to practice, and this is taught.

original: 'di'i nye bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i nye bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of this is

original: smyung ba dang / sngom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: smyung ba dang / sngom pa med pa'o //
translated: fasting and celibacy.

original: de la smyung ba ni dus ma yin par mi za ba'o //
analyzed: de la smyung ba ni dus ma yin par mi za ba'o //
translated: Of these, fasting is not eating at the wrong time.

original: sngom pa ni 'dod chags sdom par gyur cing khyim la yin na yang tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngom pa ni 'dod chags sdom par gyur cing khyim la yin na yang tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: Celibacy is the restraint of desire, and for a householder it is celibacy.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba sim pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba sim pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: The feeling of satisfaction that arises together with the five consciousnesses is pleasure.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sim pa ni dga' ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sim pa ni dga' ba ste /
translated: The satisfaction that arises together with the mental consciousness is joy.

original: des sgrub pa po rnams la sgrub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des sgrub pa po rnams la sgrub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that, the practitioners will practice.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni mkha' 'gro ma chen mo dang / de'i gzugs bsgom @186b pa'i phyi rol gyi bud med ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni mkha' 'gro ma chen mo dang / de'i gzugs bsgom @186b pa'i phyi rol gyi bud med ni shes rab bo //
translated: Wisdom is the great dakini and the external woman who meditates on her form.

original: thabs ni de la nye bar bgrod pa ste /
analyzed: thabs ni de la nye bar bgrod pa ste /
translated: The method is the approach to her.

original: bdag nyid dpal he ru ka'i gzugs su bsgoms pas nye bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dpal he ru ka'i gzugs su bsgoms pas nye bar spyod pa'o //
translated: One should enjoy the five objects of desire, such as form, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i sgras mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyang gzung ngo //
translated: by means of the five awarenesses, such as the awareness of the Dharma, etc.

original: de rnams kyis rtag tu ste thun mtshams rnams su'o //🔽shes rab dang thabs kyis re zhig ji ltar na dga' ba dang bde bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rtag tu ste thun mtshams rnams su'o // shes rab dang thabs kyis re zhig ji ltar na dga' ba dang bde bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: One should always, i.e., at all times, enjoy the five objects of desire, such as form, etc.,🔽by means of the five awarenesses, such as the awareness of the Dharma, etc.🔽How is it that one should enjoy the five objects of desire, such as form, etc.,

original: lte ba'i dbus gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: by means of the five awarenesses, such as the awareness of the Dharma, etc.?

original: lte ba ni padma'i lte ba'o //🔽de'i dbus su gnas pa de su zhig ce na /
analyzed: lte ba ni padma'i lte ba'o // de'i dbus su gnas pa de su zhig ce na /
translated: The five objects of desire are form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.🔽The five awarenesses are the awareness of the Dharma, the awareness of the pristine divine, the awareness of the vajra, the awareness of the lotus, and the awareness of the gem.

original: dpa' bo zhas bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rgyun mi 'chad par brtson pa dang ldan pas na dpa' bo ste rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhas bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rgyun mi 'chad par brtson pa dang ldan pas na dpa' bo ste rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The five objects of desire are enjoyed by means of the five awarenesses.

original: de 'dir snod gang na gnas she na /🔽karni ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'dir snod gang na gnas she na / karni ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The five awarenesses are the awareness of the Dharma, the awareness of the pristine divine, the awareness of the vajra, the awareness of the lotus, and the awareness of the gem.

original: lte ba'i padma'i karni ka la'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i padma'i karni ka la'o //
translated: The five objects of desire are enjoyed by means of the five awarenesses.

original: gsang ba'i spyod yul na gsang zhing sba bar bya ba'i phyir spyod yul te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i spyod yul na gsang zhing sba bar bya ba'i phyir spyod yul te /
translated: The secret domain is the domain of the secret, because it is to be kept secret.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar ba'i spyod snod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar ba'i spyod snod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is “the vessel of the conduct of the union of the sun and moon.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni de gnas pa'i snod bstan nas rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni de gnas pa'i snod bstan nas rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: ” Having taught the vessel of its location, in order to teach its nature, he says,

original: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “mind only,” and so on.

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Mind is consciousness.

original: tshig gcig la yang nges par gzung bar snang ste dper na chu tsam 'thung bal zas su chu 'thung zhes bya ba dang / rlung tsam za bal ba zas su rlung za zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig la yang nges par gzung bar snang ste dper na chu tsam 'thung bal zas su chu 'thung zhes bya ba dang / rlung tsam za bal ba zas su rlung za zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In one word, it appears to be a restrictive term, as in the expressions “he eats water only” and “he eats air only,” where water and air are the only food.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzung ba med pas sems kyi sgras sna tshogs 'di dag sems tsam mo zhes nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzung ba med pas sems kyi sgras sna tshogs 'di dag sems tsam mo zhes nges par gzung ngo //
translated: In the same way, here, since there is no object of perception apart from consciousness, the word “mind” is a restrictive term, meaning that all of this variety is mind only.

original: sems de yang sems med pa'o //
analyzed: sems de yang sems med pa'o //
translated: And that mind is without mind.

original: ci'i phyir sems she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems she na /
translated: Why is it mind?

original: gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without an object of perception.

original: ci'i phyir sems med pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems med pa zhe na /
translated: Why is it mindless?

original: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no apprehending subject without an apprehended object.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten na don 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes par grags la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten na don 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes par grags la /
translated: Because in the world, consciousness is known as the apprehender of objects.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid ni sems yin pas sems kyang de yin la sems med pa yang de yin pas na sems med pa'o //🔽gal te 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sems dang bral bas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid ni sems yin pas sems kyang de yin la sems med pa yang de yin pas na sems med pa'o // gal te 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sems dang bral bas /
translated: And since consciousness itself is mind, it is mind. And since it is also mindless, it is mindless.

original: de sems med pa yin na sems gang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pas de la sems zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
analyzed: de sems med pa yin na sems gang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pas de la sems zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
translated: If it is mindless because it is free from mind, which has the characteristic of apprehending, then what is the characteristic of mind, which is the reason for calling it mind?

original: sems kyi gzugs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems kyi gzugs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said that it is the form of mind.

original: @187a * // gsal ba'i phyir sems kyi gzugs te /
analyzed: @187a * // gsal ba'i phyir sems kyi gzugs te /
translated: The form of mind is clear.

original: sems dang / snang ba dang / myong ba dang / yongs su gsal ba dang / klog tu gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sems dang / snang ba dang / myong ba dang / yongs su gsal ba dang / klog tu gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: It is mind, appearance, experience, and complete clarity, up to the point where it is not read.

original: rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na sems kyi gzugs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na sems kyi gzugs te /
translated: Since this nature exists, it is the form of mind.

original: sems kyi gzugs kyi mtshan nyid de dang ldan pas sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gzugs kyi mtshan nyid de dang ldan pas sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it possesses that characteristic of the form of mind, it is called “mind.”

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa thams cad de lta bu nyid yin bzhin du dpa' bo la yang khyad par gyi rang bzhin ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa thams cad de lta bu nyid yin bzhin du dpa' bo la yang khyad par gyi rang bzhin ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Now, if all consciousnesses are just like that, what is the special nature of a hero?

original: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated: “wisdom,” etc.

original: rang ni gnyug ma'o //
analyzed: rang ni gnyug ma'o //
translated: “Self” is innate.

original: bzhin ni de'i ngo bo ste de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhin ni de'i ngo bo ste de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Nature” is its essence, its nature.

original: 'dis shes par byed pas rna ye shes yin la shes par bya bas na shes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis shes par byed pas rna ye shes yin la shes par bya bas na shes bya'o //
translated: Since this causes knowledge, it is wisdom. Since it is to be known, it is an object of knowledge.

original: ye shes dang shes bya ni zlas dbye ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes dang shes bya ni zlas dbye ba ste /
translated: Wisdom and object of knowledge are a compound.

original: ye shes bya ba'i rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na ye shes zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gzhag go //
analyzed: ye shes bya ba'i rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na ye shes zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gzhag go //
translated: Since this has the nature of what is called “wisdom,” it is called “the nature of wisdom.”

original: de la so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni rang bzhin ma yin pa yang shes byar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni rang bzhin ma yin pa yang shes byar 'gyur te /
translated: Among them, the nature of ordinary beings is not an object of knowledge.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag de dag gis brtags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag de dag gis brtags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the apprehended and apprehender are imputed by them.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dngos por med bzhin du de rnams la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dngos por med bzhin du de rnams la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspects of the object and subject appear to them, even though they do not exist as entities.

original: gang yang med pa dang / dngos po ma yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i gnyug ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang med pa dang / dngos po ma yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i gnyug ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: And that which is nonexistent and not an entity is not the intrinsic nature of consciousness.

original: 'o na ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: 'khrul pas sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pas sgro btags pa ste /
translated: It is a superimposition due to error.

original: 'khrul bas mtshan mar gzung pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'khrul bas mtshan mar gzung pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it is apprehended as a sign due to error, it is called the sign of error.🔽And the consciousness of those whose objects are not its intrinsic nature will also not be its intrinsic nature.

original: gang dag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i shes byar gyur pa de rnams kyi ye shes kyang rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur te 'di dag 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i shes byar gyur pa de rnams kyi ye shes kyang rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur te 'di dag 'khrul pa'o //

original: 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i dbang gis med pa dang dngos po ma yin pa yang snang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i dbang gis med pa dang dngos po ma yin pa yang snang ste /

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa de yang de dag gi shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa de yang de dag gi shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, that error is not their consciousness,

original: snang ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'khrul pa de ni blo yis bslad pa yin gyi blo'i gnyug ma'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa de ni blo yis bslad pa yin gyi blo'i gnyug ma'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /

original: dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the defilements are adventitious.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin pa yang de rnams kyi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin pa yang de rnams kyi shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of those is not intrinsic nature.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The ultimate thought of awakening is the nature of non-elaborative intuition.

original: spros pa ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Elaboration is error.

original: de bas na de la spros pa thams cad med pas rang bzhin nyid de'i ye shes yin gyi 'khrul pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de la spros pa thams cad med pas rang bzhin nyid de'i ye shes yin gyi 'khrul pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since all elaborations are absent in that , it is the intrinsic nature of that intuition, but is not error,

original: spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad de la mi snang @187b zhing nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad de la mi snang @187b zhing nub pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rang bzhin nyid de'i shes bya yin gyi med pa dang dngos po ma yin pa yang yin ma yin no //
translated: That is the object of knowledge of its intrinsic nature, but is not non-existent and is not a thing.

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed po nges ni dpa' bo'i don dam pa'i byang chub sems kyi spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin dngos su bstan nas bde ba chen po'i ngo bo ni shugs kyis ston pa ste /

translated: The first half of the verse directly teaches the nature of the essence of great bliss, which is the nature of the hero’s ultimate reality, the nonconceptual gnosis of the mind of enlightenment.

original: spros pa med pa'i ye shes dang bde ba chen po ni lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i ye shes dang bde ba chen po ni lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonconceptual gnosis and great bliss are coemergent.

original: de skad du rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las /
analyzed: de skad du rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las /
translated: Thus it is said in the Nonconceptual Gnosis Dhāraṇī:🔽The bodhisattvas, children of the victors,

original: dam chos 'di la rgyal sras rnams //
analyzed: dam chos 'di la rgyal sras rnams //
translated: who abide in this holy Dharma

original: mi rtog bsam pas brtan gnas na //

analyzed: rim gyis rgal dka' rtog pa las //

original: 'das nas rnam par mi rtog rnyed //
analyzed: 'das nas rnam par mi rtog rnyed //
translated: and attain nonconceptual gnosis.

original: rab zhi mi g-yo rnam pa ste //
analyzed: rab zhi mi g-yo rnam pa ste //
translated: It is peace, immobility,

original: dbang bsgyur mi mnyam mnyam pa yin //
analyzed: dbang bsgyur mi mnyam mnyam pa yin //
translated: mastery, equality, and inequality.

original: rnam par mi rtog bde ba ni //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog bde ba ni //
translated: The bliss of nonconceptuality

original: byang chub sems dpa' de las thob //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de las thob // ces gsungs te /
translated: is attained by the bodhisattvas.

original: dam chos 'di la zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: dam chos 'di la zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'o //

analyzed: rgyal sras zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The “sons of the victors” are the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: brtan gnas zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo bar gnas pa'o //
translated: “ Steadfast” means “unwavering.”

original: rnam rtog 'di ni rgal dka' ba ste /
analyzed: rnam rtog 'di ni rgal dka' ba ste /
translated: This is the difficult-to-conquer conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of conceptualization.

original: rim bzhin 'das pa ni de las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rim bzhin 'das pa ni de las 'das pa'o //
translated: “ In order” means “in that order.”

original: mi rtog rnyed pa ni rnam par mi rtog cing spros pa med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: mi rtog rnyed pa ni rnam par mi rtog cing spros pa med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: “ Attaining the nonconceptual” means attaining nonconceptual, nonelaborate wisdom.

original: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de nyid kyi bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de nyid kyi bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one attains the bliss of that very nonconceptual wisdom.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa med pas na rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa med pas na rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: Here, it is “peaceful” because of the absence of afflictions.

original: nyams pa med pas ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: nyams pa med pas ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is “unwavering” because of the absence of degeneration.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde pa thams cad las 'phags pas na dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde pa thams cad las 'phags pas na dam pa'o //
translated: It is “supreme” because it is superior to all mundane and supramundane bliss.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa dang ji snyed 'dod pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir dbang bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa dang ji snyed 'dod pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir dbang bsgyur ba'o //
translated: It is “mastery” because one actualizes it as one wishes and to the extent one wishes.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bde ba dang rigs mtshungs pas na mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bde ba dang rigs mtshungs pas na mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is equal because it is similar to the other bliss.

original: khyad par bzhi po de dag gis khyad par du 'phags pas na mi mnyam pa yang yin no //
analyzed: khyad par bzhi po de dag gis khyad par du 'phags pas na mi mnyam pa yang yin no //
translated: It is unequalled because it is distinguished by these four distinctions.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dpa' bo de ni bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dpa' bo de ni bdag gis bshad par bya'o zhes bya'o //
translated: I will explain that hero who is such.

original: theg pa gang la grags she na /
analyzed: theg pa gang la grags she na /
translated: In what vehicle is it renowned?

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: theg pa gang gis sangs rgyas su 'gyur pa'i bstan pa ni sangs rgyas bstan pa ste /

analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i don to // 'o na sngar tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis de bstan @188a * //
translated: The meaning of “great vehicle” is stated.

analyzed: zin bzhin du yang bshad pas ci zhig brjod ce na /
translated: But if it was already taught in the first half of the verse, what is the point of teaching it again?

analyzed: de'i phyir zab mo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is profound is stated.

translated: The Mantra Vehicle is profound in the Great Vehicle, because the Mantra Vehicle is to be cultivated in the Perfection Vehicle, because the Mantra Vehicle accomplishes enlightenment quickly, by the form of the seal of the Thought of Enlightenment together with its retinue.

original: bya ste / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ste / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be cultivated because of the difference in characteristics.

original: de yang da dung ma gsungs te /

translated: And that is not yet explained.

original: de bas na bshad par bya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bshad par bya zhes gsungs so //

original: de nyid a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: That itself is called the “Alikāli,” etc.

analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar ba la'o //
translated: There, “in that” means in the union of the sun and moon.

analyzed: nges par sbyar zhes bya ba ni nges par bcing ba'i phyir sbyar ba'o //
translated: “To be applied” means to be bound.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What?

analyzed: ji ltar sbyar zhe na /

analyzed: a'a li k'a li dag mnyam pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: ji ltar mnyam par bya zhe na /

analyzed: de skad du /

original: zhes 'og nas bstan par 'gyur la /

translated: It is nectar because it is liberation and because it is inexhaustible.

analyzed: bde ba chen po'o //

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: thigs pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: bde ba chen po'i kha dog dkar po'i thig le'i gzugs kyis dpa' bo zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: khu ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir khu ba'i sgras bstan te /
translated: It is taught by the word “fluid” because it is similar to a fluid, since it has the nature of the cool and blissful taste of pure gnosis.

original: tshul des 'bab cing 'dzag pa ste /
analyzed: tshul des 'bab cing 'dzag pa ste /
translated: It falls and drips in that manner.

analyzed: de nyid 'dzag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: thigs pa'i gzugs zhes bya bas ni de'i phyag rgya'i rnam pa bstan to //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni stong pa'i gzugs can no //

analyzed: gang yang de'i gsal zhing bde ni sems kyi gzugs so //
translated: And since there is clarity and bliss, there is the form of mind.🔽And since the mind rests in just that, all elaborations subside, and this is called pristine wisdom.

analyzed: gang yang de tsam la sems gnas pas spros pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma nub pa de ni de'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin bdag go //
