analyzed: h'um gi don ni sku dang gsung dang thugs snang ba med pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The meaning of HUM is the equality of body, speech, and mind, since they are non-apparent.

original: h'um ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje //
analyzed: h'um ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje //
translated: HUM is the indivisible vajra body, speech, and mind,

original: gsum po mi phyed mnyam thob pa //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum po mi phyed mnyam thob pa // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: attained as the equality of the three.

original: de bas na aom gyis sna tshogs 'di dag sems tsam nyid du bstan pa la bltas pas ni dngos po rnam par spangs pa'o//
analyzed: de bas na aom gyis sna tshogs 'di dag sems tsam nyid du bstan pa la bltas pas ni dngos po rnam par spangs pa'o//
translated: Thus, OM shows that these various things are just mind only, and by seeing that, one abandons things.

original: sna tshogs 'di dag sems tsam po da nyid dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di dag sems tsam po da nyid dngos po med pa ste /
translated: These various things are just mind only, and are not things, because there are no things apart from mind.

original: sems las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa'i sems tsam po de nyid kyang snang ba med pas mnyam pa nyid du 'jug par h'um gyis ston par byed de //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa'i sems tsam po de nyid kyang snang ba med pas mnyam pa nyid du 'jug par h'um gyis ston par byed de //
translated: HUM shows that even that mere mind of various things is non-apparent, and thus enters into equality.

original: de la bltas pas ni dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bltas pas ni dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: By looking at that, one should avoid non-entity.

original: 'o na 'dir sems tsam dang mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ji ltar lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir sems tsam dang mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ji ltar lta zhe na /
translated: Now, how does one look at the mind-only and the entry into sameness?

original: 'dir man ngag ni rab sngags brjod nas dpa' bo las dbugs gtong ba ni lhan cig tu ye shes kyi 'od zer steng du rgyu bar bltas la /
analyzed: 'dir man ngag ni rab sngags brjod nas dpa' bo las dbugs gtong ba ni lhan cig tu ye shes kyi 'od zer steng du rgyu bar bltas la /
translated: Here, the instruction is that, having recited the mantra, one should look at the hero exhaling, the light rays of intuition moving upward together.

original: de spros pas sna tshogs sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: de spros pas sna tshogs sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du byas te /
translated: Having emanated that, one should make the various buddhas.

analyzed: sa bon gyi yi ge brjod nas sna tshogs sangs rgyas su byas pa de dag rang gi lha'i rnam par bsgom pa ni sems tsam du blta ba'o //
translated: Having recited the seed syllable, one should meditate on those various buddhas in the aspect of one’s deity. This is looking at the mind-only.

original: de nas h'um brjod pas dbugs 'jug pas na sna tshogs dpa' bo la bsdu ba ni mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa la blta'o //
analyzed: de nas h'um brjod pas dbugs 'jug pas na sna tshogs dpa' bo la bsdu ba ni mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa la blta'o //
translated: Then, having recited hūṃ, one should look at the inhalation gathering the various heroes into sameness.

original: de dag gnyig yang dal bus yang dang yang du ji @192b srid dal par ma gyur gyi bar du bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gnyig yang dal bus yang dang yang du ji @192b srid dal par ma gyur gyi bar du bya ste /
translated: One should do both of those slowly, again and again, until one becomes relaxed.

original: 'dir na rgyud 'dir bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir na rgyud 'dir bzlas pa'o //
translated: Here, this is the recitation in this tantra.

original: 'di tshegs med par nyams su blangs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di tshegs med par nyams su blangs pa gsungs pa /

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: de la zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa la'o //

analyzed: brtul zhugs zhes bya ba ni mi smra ba dang / khrus dang / slong mo la sogs pa'i des pa med pa'o //
translated: Vow means the vow of silence, bathing, begging, and so on.

original: phreng ba sngags dang bzung bzhes bya ba ni srog gi rlung gi'o //
analyzed: phreng ba sngags dang bzung bzhes bya ba ni srog gi rlung gi'o //
translated: The mantra rosary is held means of the life-force wind.

analyzed: ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan dag las 'byung ba 'dir mi drangs zhing bzlog par bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is reversed means that which occurs in other tantras is not brought here and is to be reversed.

original: gzhan dang gzhan dag ces bya ba las kyang gi don la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan dag ces bya ba las kyang gi don la blta bar bya ste /
translated: And other and other means that the meaning of and is to be seen.

original: de las gzhan pa'i las thams cad kyang bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i las thams cad kyang bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all other actions are to be reversed.

original: 'o na bzlas pa ni brjod pa yin la 'dir bzlas pa 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na bzlas pa ni brjod pa yin la 'dir bzlas pa 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin nam /
translated: Well then, repetition is recitation, and is only repetition to be recited here,

original: 'on te sku dang ye shes kyang bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sku dang ye shes kyang bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: or is the body and wisdom also to be cultivated?

analyzed: de'i phyir sngags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says mantra, etc.

analyzed: de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Concentration focused on reality is yoga.

original: rnal 'byor de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And that yoga is threefold.

original: bye brag gsum mo //
analyzed: bye brag gsum mo //
translated: There are three varieties.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

analyzed: gang gi phyir sngags dang / dbyibs dang / chos kyi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Because of the nature of mantra, form, and reality.

original: de la de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i ngag ni sngags so //
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i ngag ni sngags so //
translated: Therein, mantra is speech that illuminates reality.

original: lha'i sku ni dbyibs so //
analyzed: lha'i sku ni dbyibs so //
translated: Form is the body of the deity.

original: sngags kyi don gyi ye shes ni chos so //
analyzed: sngags kyi don gyi ye shes ni chos so //
translated: Reality is the intuition of the meaning of mantra.

original: ye shes rnam pa gsum gyis ni zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum gyis yin gyi brjod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa gsum gyis ni zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum gyis yin gyi brjod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: By the three kinds of intuition means by the three kinds of yoga just explained, not by mere verbal expression.

original: srid pa'i nyes pas goms mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i nyes pas goms mi 'gyur //
translated: One is not habituated by the faults of existence.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therein,

analyzed: srid pa'i nyes pa ste sdig pa la sogs pa rnams las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one is liberated from the faults of existence, such as sin.

analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gsum mo // rgyun du zhes bya ba ni nyin re zhing ngo //
translated: “Thus” refers to the three yogas.🔽“Always” means every day.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni thun mtshams so so la'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni thun mtshams so so la'o //
translated: “Constantly” means in each period.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni dpal he ru ka'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni dpal he ru ka'o //
translated: “Vajrasattva” is Śrī Heruka.

analyzed: mtshungs pa ni de dang mnyam ba'o //

analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams dang yang mnyam pa'o //

analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'o //

translated: Here, one should meditate on the pride of being Heruka or a ḍākinī,

analyzed: rab sngags dang h'um gi dbus su rtsa ba'i sngags bcug @193a * //
translated: and insert the root mantra in the middle of the mantra and hūṃ.

translated: Reciting the mantra slowly and gradually, one should place the hero’s drop on the bindu of the knowledge-letter, which is the essence of the sun and moon joined together.

analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'od kyis dngos po thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du byas nas de rnams kyis rang gi lha'i sku'i rnam par byas te /
translated: Having made all things the nature of the Buddha by the light arising from that, they are made into the form of one's own deity's body.

analyzed: dpa' bo'i thig le las yang dag par bsdu bas sngags kyi don rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar sngags dang / dbyibs dang / chos kyi rnal 'byor gyis zla pa drug tu bzlas pa byas na 'dra ba'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having done the repetition for six months with the yoga of mantra, shape, and reality, one will attain the magical powers.

analyzed: de bas na rig pa'i yi ge dang de'i rab tu sbyor ba yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: dpa' bo'i snod du gur gum gyi mdog lta bu'i rab sngags bsams te /

translated: Having bound the neck of the victim with the noose,

analyzed: rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya rnam pa du ma ste gang 'dod pa'o //

translated: Here the meaning of again and again should be understood.

analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa yang dam du 'gyur na /
translated: If the entire triple world is firmly bound,

analyzed: de'i gsang ba'i yi ge'i yang yi ge'o //

translated: The syllable A is a disyllabic compound.

analyzed: de dag dang yang dag par ldan pa ni aa'am yi ge h'um dang yang dag par ldan pa'i sgrub pa po zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The practitioner who is endowed with that is the practitioner who is endowed with the syllable A or the syllable HŪṀ.

original: rnam pa gsum pa dang sbyor ba ni sbyor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa dang sbyor ba ni sbyor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three-fold application is the three-fold application.

original: sku gsung thugs la legs gnas pa //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs la legs gnas pa //
translated: Well-placed in body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i lus dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dag tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i lus dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dag tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The body, throat, and heart of the one to be accomplished are the places of placement.

original: des kyang 'di skad du lha drug gi nang nas dza ba'i ku su ma lta bu gnag yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor @194a * //
analyzed: des kyang 'di skad du lha drug gi nang nas dza ba'i ku su ma lta bu gnag yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor @194a * //
translated: Also, it is stated that among the six deities, one should practice with the one like a jasmine flower, black or otherwise.

original: byas la / kha sbyor gyi nang du a'a'am yi ge h'um gi mgo dang thig ler dpa' bo bkod la yam las bskyed pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bsgrub bya bskyon te /
analyzed: byas la / kha sbyor gyi nang du a'a'am yi ge h'um gi mgo dang thig ler dpa' bo bkod la yam las bskyed pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bsgrub bya bskyon te /
translated: Having arranged the hero in the head and drop of the syllable A or the syllable HŪṀ in the embrace, one should place the one to be accomplished on the wind maṇḍala generated from YAṂ.

original: dpa' bo'i 'od zer gyi ri mo dmar po gnyis kyis rtse mo'i zhags pa dang lcags kyu dag gi go rims bzhin du mgrin pa bcings pa dang / snying ga phug ste bar snang las myur du 'gugs par bsams na skad cig gis khugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i 'od zer gyi ri mo dmar po gnyis kyis rtse mo'i zhags pa dang lcags kyu dag gi go rims bzhin du mgrin pa bcings pa dang / snying ga phug ste bar snang las myur du 'gugs par bsams na skad cig gis khugs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that if one imagines that, in an instant, the summoned one will arrive.

original: yi ge khe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yi ge khe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the line beginning the syllable khe, etc.,

original: de dag gis kyang 'di skad du yi ge khe las sku mdog dkar po zhal bzhi la phyag na thod pa bsnams pa chags pa'i bdag nyid de sems chags pa dang ldan par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang 'di skad du yi ge khe las sku mdog dkar po zhal bzhi la phyag na thod pa bsnams pa chags pa'i bdag nyid de sems chags pa dang ldan par bsgoms la /
translated: they also explain it in this way: From the syllable khe, one should meditate on a white-colored form with four faces and skull-cups in the hands, having the nature of passion, and endowed with passionate mind.

original: khe'i mgo bor bkod pa'i dpa' po las 'od zer sbu gu'i gzugs can bsgrub bya'i gsang par zhugs te khu bas bkang nas thod par drangs par bsams na skad cig gis khu ba khugs par 'gyur ro zhas ston to //
analyzed: khe'i mgo bor bkod pa'i dpa' po las 'od zer sbu gu'i gzugs can bsgrub bya'i gsang par zhugs te khu bas bkang nas thod par drangs par bsams na skad cig gis khu ba khugs par 'gyur ro zhas ston to //
translated: If one imagines that the light rays in the form of tubes from the hero placed on the head of khe enter the secret of the one to be summoned, fill him with semen, and draw him into the skull-cup, in an instant, the summoned one will arrive.

original: yi ge tsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yi ge tsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the line beginning the syllable ci, etc.,

original: yi ge tsi thung ngu las mdog ser po 'od zer ser po dang ldan pa rta'i zhal can bsams la /
analyzed: yi ge tsi thung ngu las mdog ser po 'od zer ser po dang ldan pa rta'i zhal can bsams la /
translated: From the short syllable ci, one should imagine a yellow color with yellow light rays and the face of a horse.

original: yi ge tsa'i mgo bor gnas pa'i dpa' bo'i 'od glang po che'i sna lta bus chang snod chang gis bkang nas drangs te snod gang bar bsams na skad cig gis gang bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: yi ge tsa'i mgo bor gnas pa'i dpa' bo'i 'od glang po che'i sna lta bus chang snod chang gis bkang nas drangs te snod gang bar bsams na skad cig gis gang bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: The hero who resides at the head of the syllable ci, with a light like the trunk of an elephant, draws a vessel of beer filled with beer. If one imagines the vessel filled, it will be filled in an instant.

original: yi ge ra zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang yi ge ra las mdog dmar po phyag bzhi la ce spyang gi zhal bzhi dang ldan pa gzi brjid che zhing khro ba'i bdag nyid can du bsgoms la /
analyzed: yi ge ra zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang yi ge ra las mdog dmar po phyag bzhi la ce spyang gi zhal bzhi dang ldan pa gzi brjid che zhing khro ba'i bdag nyid can du bsgoms la /
translated: Also, with the syllable ra, and so on, from the syllable ra, one should meditate on a red color, four faces, and four faces of a jackal, with great splendor and an angry nature.

original: snga ma bzhin du 'od zer srin po padma'i gzugs lta bur spros pas bsgrub bya'i lus las khrag 'dren bzhin par bsgoms na snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'od zer srin po padma'i gzugs lta bur spros pas bsgrub bya'i lus las khrag 'dren bzhin par bsgoms na snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: As before, one should meditate on the light rays emanating like a cannibal in the form of a lotus, drawing blood from the body of the victim, as before.

original: de ltar rig pa'i yi ge drug gi skabs su rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi yan lag drug la dgod pa yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rig pa'i yi ge drug gi skabs su rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi yan lag drug la dgod pa yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to show the six limbs of the yoga of one's deity in the context of the six syllables of knowledge,

original: yi ge drug dang zhas bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yi ge drug dang zhas bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “the six syllables,” and so forth.

original: yi ge drug dang bstan ma thag pa'i rig pa'i yi ge drug go //
analyzed: yi ge drug dang bstan ma thag pa'i rig pa'i yi ge drug go //
translated: The six syllables are the six syllables of knowledge just explained.

original: de dang yang dag ldan zhes bya ba ni nges sbyar bya zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de dang yang dag ldan zhes bya ba ni nges sbyar bya zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: “Endowed with those” is to be connected with “should be applied.”

original: rang gi lha'i lus la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i lus la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “To one’s deity’s body” is the remainder.

original: gang du ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang du ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: Where is it applied?

original: gnas drug tu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas drug tu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “in the six places.”

original: yan lag drug tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag drug tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “in the six limbs.”

original: de lta bus ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams @194b 'grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bus ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams @194b 'grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the vajra yoginīs are accomplished by that, not otherwise.

original: de la rdo rje ni dpal he ru ka'o //
analyzed: de la rdo rje ni dpal he ru ka'o //
translated: There, the vajra is Śrī Heruka.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams so //
translated: The yoginīs are the five ḍākinīs.

original: yang na rnal 'byor ni dpal he ru ka'o //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor ni dpal he ru ka'o //
translated: Alternatively, the yoga is Śrī Heruka.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i bde mchog ni rnal 'byor ma de rnams dang lhan cig tu spyod pa las byung ba'i bde ba'i mchog dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i bde mchog ni rnal 'byor ma de rnams dang lhan cig tu spyod pa las byung ba'i bde ba'i mchog dang ldan pas so //
translated: The supreme bliss of the dakinis is the supreme bliss that arises from the practice with those yoginis.

original: gnas drug po bstan pa de nye bar bstan pa'i phyir mig gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas drug po bstan pa de nye bar bstan pa'i phyir mig gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach those six places, he says, “the two eyes,” and so on.

original: yid ces bya ba ni snying ga'o //
analyzed: yid ces bya ba ni snying ga'o //
translated: The “mind” is the heart.

original: dang gi sgras ni lce dang lus kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni lce dang lus kyang gzung ngo //
translated: The word “and” includes the tongue and the body.

original: rnal 'byor rnam pa gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnam pa gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: He teaches another kind of yoga:

original: seng ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: seng ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: the lion, and so on.

original: seng ge ni dpa' bo'o //
analyzed: seng ge ni dpa' bo'o //
translated: The lion is the hero.

original: de'i rnam par rol pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rol pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who has the play of that is called the “lion-like one.”

original: phyag rgya ni nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The seal is the union of the sun and moon.

original: bcing bar bya ba ni yi ge'i phreng pa gsum gyis sngar bstan pa bzhin du bcings par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bcing bar bya ba ni yi ge'i phreng pa gsum gyis sngar bstan pa bzhin du bcings par bsam pa'o //
translated: The one to be bound is the three-line mantra, which is imagined to be bound as previously taught.

original: rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa'o //
translated: The yogī/nī is one who is abiding in the yoga of Śrī Heruka surrounded by the four goddesses.

original: srog dang rtsol ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa'o //
translated: Prāṇa and āyāma are exhalation and inhalation.

original: bsdams nas su zhes bya ba ni rim gyis shin tu phra bar byas pas shin tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdams nas su zhes bya ba ni rim gyis shin tu phra bar byas pas shin tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having restrained, means that by making it very subtle in stages, it becomes very stable.

original: bsgoms na zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i bu ga nas dpa' bo de nyid la blta bzhin pas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms na zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i bu ga nas dpa' bo de nyid la blta bzhin pas bsgom pa'o //
translated: If one meditates, means that one meditates by looking at that hero through the hole of the moon.

original: skad cig de la 'bar zhes bya ba ni dpa' bo la sems brtan pa las ye shes kyi me lce ldang zhing 'bar ba ste snang bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig de la 'bar zhes bya ba ni dpa' bo la sems brtan pa las ye shes kyi me lce ldang zhing 'bar ba ste snang bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In that instant, it blazes, means that from the mind being stable in the hero, the flame of the wisdom fire arises and blazes, which means that it illuminates.

original: ji skad du slebs par 'bar zhes bya /
analyzed: ji skad du slebs par 'bar zhes bya /
translated: As it is said, “What is blazing?”

original: 'og min zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sa 'og dang / sa steng dang / bar snang dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa rnams yang dag par bsdus pas ni 'jig rten bdun no //
analyzed: 'og min zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sa 'og dang / sa steng dang / bar snang dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa rnams yang dag par bsdus pas ni 'jig rten bdun no //
translated: The Akanistha and so on are stated. The seven worlds are the underworld, the earth, the sky, the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum po ni so sor re re yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum po ni so sor re re yin la /
translated: The three concentrations are each one.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas gzhan brgyad pa ni 'og min te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas gzhan brgyad pa ni 'og min te /
translated: The fourth concentration is the Akanistha, the eighth abode.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa'i 'og min gnas kyi mthar thug pa zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa'i 'og min gnas kyi mthar thug pa zhes so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the ultimate abode of Akanistha.

original: de la rgyu ba ni sems can no //
analyzed: de la rgyu ba ni sems can no //
translated: Among them, the moving ones are sentient beings.

original: gzhal med khang la sogs pa'i gnas ni mi rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal med khang la sogs pa'i gnas ni mi rgyu ba'o //
translated: The abodes such as the celestial palaces are the unmoving ones.

original: da ni dpa' bo de sems can thams cad kyi snang bzhin du mthong bar bstan par bzhed nas /🔽thams @195a * //
analyzed: da ni dpa' bo de sems can thams cad kyi snang bzhin du mthong bar bstan par bzhed nas / thams @195a * //
translated: Now, wishing to teach that this hero is seen as if illuminating all sentient beings,

original: cad kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: cad kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says of all and so on.

original: thams cad kyi ni sems zhes ba ste sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni sems zhes ba ste sems can thams cad do //
translated: Of all means of all sentient beings.

original: de bsgoms nas zhes bya ba ni 'dris par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bsgoms nas zhes bya ba ni 'dris par bya ba ste /
translated: Having meditated on that means having become familiar with it,

original: rang gi sems nyid de dang de dag tu snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid de dang de dag tu snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one's own mind appears as just that.

original: de ni rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not realization means that one does not see reality,

original: byis pa rnams la de'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la de'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the unreal nature of that appears to the childish.

original: 'gro ba'i rol ba zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su rol pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rol ba zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su rol pa ste /
translated: The play of the world is the play of diversity,

original: de dang de'i rnam pa gnyis su brtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de'i rnam pa gnyis su brtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is imagined as two aspects.

original: rnam par 'jig ces bya ba ni gal te kun gyis rtog na ni 'gro ba'i rol pa dang bo nyid nas zhig par 'gyur na da ltar gyi bar du de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig ces bya ba ni gal te kun gyis rtog na ni 'gro ba'i rol pa dang bo nyid nas zhig par 'gyur na da ltar gyi bar du de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were imagined by everyone, the play of the world would have been destroyed from the beginning, but it is not like that up to the present.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu yin pa'i phyir ye shes 'di gsang zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu yin pa'i phyir ye shes 'di gsang zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is like that, it is said this wisdom is secret.

original: ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid dpa' bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid dpa' bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the nondual reality, called heroic.

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams la sbas pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams la sbas pa'o //
translated: The secret is that it is hidden from the childish.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: yang dag pa yin pa'i ngo bo ma mthong ba'i 'khrul pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yang dag pa yin pa'i ngo bo ma mthong ba'i 'khrul pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By those who are deluded by not seeing the nature of reality.

original: ye shes de ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes de ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is that intuition like?

original: mi gsal yi ge med pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi gsal yi ge med pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be unclear and without syllables.

original: ngag gi yul las 'das pa'i phyir na mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: ngag gi yul las 'das pa'i phyir na mi gsal ba'o //
translated: It is unclear because it is beyond the domain of speech.

original: yid kyis brjod pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir yi ge med pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis brjod pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir yi ge med pa'o //
translated: It is without syllables because it is not the domain of mental expression.

original: 'o na de'i don dam pa de sus shes na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i don dam pa de sus shes na /
translated: Well, then, who knows that reality?

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, The buddhas, etc.

original: hi zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar bas nges par gzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: hi zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar bas nges par gzung ba'i don te /
translated: The word hi means just, and is used to emphasize the following.

original: de bzhin gshags pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshags pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means just by the Tathāgatas themselves.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang rang bzhin de phyis gzigs na ni gzhan gyis kyang de mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang rang bzhin de phyis gzigs na ni gzhan gyis kyang de mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Well, then, if the Tathāgatas see that nature only later, then others would also see it.

original: ci ste rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi kha na las pa yin na yang rnal 'byor des gzhan dag gis kyang de mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi kha na las pa yin na yang rnal 'byor des gzhan dag gis kyang de mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is an object of the Vajrayoga, then it would be seen by others through that yoga.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “yoga” and so on.

original: gcig kho nar g-yo ba med pa'i phyir gnyid dang chos mthun pas na gnyid do //
analyzed: gcig kho nar g-yo ba med pa'i phyir gnyid dang chos mthun pas na gnyid do //
translated: It is sleep because it is similar to sleep in that it is motionless.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor yang yin la gnyid kyang yin pas rnal 'byor gnyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor yang yin la gnyid kyang yin pas rnal 'byor gnyid do //
translated: It is both a yoga and sleep, so it is a yoga sleep.

original: yang dag par ldan pa ni mnga'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ldan pa ni mnga'o //
translated: It is possessed, i.e., it is present.

original: de nyid nye bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid nye bar bstan pa ni /
translated: That is taught:

original: gong bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gong bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: “in the form of a ball” and so on.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “Form” is the nature of all phenomena.

original: gcig ces bya ba @195b ni snang ba med cing gsal ba tsam du ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba @195b ni snang ba med cing gsal ba tsam du ro gcig pa'o //
translated: “One” is the single taste of the mere clarity that is free from appearances.

original: gong bu zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid shin tu bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: gong bu zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid shin tu bsdus pa ste /
translated: “Ball” is the extreme condensation of those.

original: yungs kar ltar phra ba'i thig le tsam gyi gong bur phra mor byas pa'o //
analyzed: yungs kar ltar phra ba'i thig le tsam gyi gong bur phra mor byas pa'o //
translated: It is made subtle, i.e., made into a subtle drop, the size of a mustard seed.

original: de dag gis ni dpa' bo'i phyag rgya gzugs su bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni dpa' bo'i phyag rgya gzugs su bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: Those explain the accomplishment of the hero’s seal in form.

original: der song ba'i yid ces bya ba ni gong bu de la sems gnas pa'o //
analyzed: der song ba'i yid ces bya ba ni gong bu de la sems gnas pa'o //
translated: “Having gone there with the mind” means the mind is situated in that aggregate.

original: de dag gis rnal 'byor gyi gnyid kyi don bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis rnal 'byor gyi gnyid kyi don bstan to //
translated: Those explain the meaning of the yoga of sleep.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rnal 'byor rdzogs par byed pa'i dam tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rnal 'byor rdzogs par byed pa'i dam tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the pledge of perfecting the yoga of that kind,

original: sgo dgu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sgo dgu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “from the nine doors,” and so on.

original: rnam bsgoms la zhes bya ba ni lhag par mos par zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: rnam bsgoms la zhes bya ba ni lhag par mos par zhes bya ba'i don to /

original: gang zhig la lhag par mos par bya zhe na /

original: sgo dgu las byung ba'i rdzas la'o //

original: ci zhig tu mos she na /
analyzed: ci zhig tu mos she na /

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “one’s own self,”

original: rtag pa dang mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen dbang dang / 'jig rten dbang dang / gdon mi za ba'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi bdag nyid du'o //

analyzed: rang bzhin med pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par mi snang bas so //

analyzed: blo ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba tsam la gnas pa'i blo can no //

original: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dogs pa med pas so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dogs pa med pas so //

original: bza' zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bza' ba'i phyir spyad pa'o //
analyzed: bza' zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bza' ba'i phyir spyad pa'o //
translated: The food is the practice for consuming conceptual thoughts.

original: mthe bong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mthe bong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding thumb and so forth,

original: sgo ru yid bzhin nor bu zhes bya ba ni mthe bod dang srin lag gi rtse mo yid bzhin gyi nor bu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgo ru yid bzhin nor bu zhes bya ba ni mthe bod dang srin lag gi rtse mo yid bzhin gyi nor bu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the wish-fulfilling jewel at the gate means the tip of the thumb and ring finger becoming a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: de bas na de nyid kyis des bza'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid kyis des bza'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that by that, one should eat with that.

original: nam zhe na /
analyzed: nam zhe na /
translated: When?

original: bdud rtsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said nectar and so forth.

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'og nas byung ba'i chogs de dag thams cad bdud rtsir byas pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means when all those things that will arise below are made into nectar.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that?

original: rtag pa'i dngos grub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos grub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: rnal 'byor ma'i rig pa chen mo zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i rig pa chen mo zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The great knowledge of Yoginī has been explained.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar ba'i thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar ba'i thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Its application is the yoga of the drop of the sun and moon in union.

analyzed: de seng ge rnam par rol pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gang dag gis nges par byed pa de ni gtan la phab ste bstan pa ni brjod pa'o //
translated: That which ascertains it by means of the distinctions of the lion's play and so on is determined and taught, that is, described.

original: dpal sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i 'grel pa yon tan ldan pa las nges par bstan pa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: dpal sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i 'grel pa yon tan ldan pa las nges par bstan pa gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter in the commentary on the Great Magical Illusion, which possesses good qualities.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs @196a * //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs @196a * //
translated: Then, and so on.

analyzed: pa la / rdzas gzhan zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rdzas dgu las gzhan pa'o //

analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba ni tshogs las tha mi dad pa'i phyir so so re re zhing yang tshogs kyi sgras bstan to //

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bu yin pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu'o //

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni rdzas kyi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni rdzas kyi tshogs rnams so //
translated: That refers to the collection of substances.

original: 'byung po'i ma ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung po'i ma ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
translated: The mother of beings are the Vajra dakinis.

original: chen por yang dag ldan pa ni yon tan che bas brgyan pa ste /

translated: Possessing the great is adorned with great qualities.

original: sha chen po'o //
analyzed: sha chen po'o //
translated: It is great flesh.

analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bsdu ba'o //

original: lhan cig ma yin zhes bya ba ni so sor ro//

original: bsgos zhes bya ba ni byug pa ste /
analyzed: bsgos zhes bya ba ni byug pa ste /

analyzed: sha lnga po so so zhing bdud rtsi lnga lngas bsgo ba'o //
translated: Each of the five meats is smeared with each of the five nectars.

original: dus ji snyed cig tu zhu zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji snyed cig tu zhu zhe na /
translated: For how long should one cook them?

original: nyi ma bdun du zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: mar ngo'i nyi shu gsum nas nyi shu dgu'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mar ngo'i nyi shu gsum nas nyi shu dgu'i bar du'o //
translated: From the twenty-third to the twenty-ninth of the waning phase.

original: sbyar byas nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar byas pa'i 'og tu sbyar nas so //
analyzed: sbyar byas nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar byas pa'i 'og tu sbyar nas so //
translated: Having prepared means having applied after doing that.

original: ce sbyang gi dbus su gzhag la zhes bya ba ni 'byung po'i mtshan mo ce spyang gi yan lag mchog tu gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ce sbyang gi dbus su gzhag la zhes bya ba ni 'byung po'i mtshan mo ce spyang gi yan lag mchog tu gzhag pa'o //
translated: In the middle of a jackal means in the middle of a jackal's limb, which is the best.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgos pa dang gzhag pa'i rdzas las so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgos pa dang gzhag pa'i rdzas las so //
translated: There means from the substance that has been anointed and placed in that way.

original: yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshang tsam zhes bya ba ni yungs kar gyi tshad tsam mo //
analyzed: yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshang tsam zhes bya ba ni yungs kar gyi tshad tsam mo //
translated: The size of a mustard seed means the size of a mustard seed.

original: ci las byas she na /
analyzed: ci las byas she na /
translated: What is it made of?

original: lnga po dag ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lnga po dag ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The five are said.

original: sha lnga po dag las so //
analyzed: sha lnga po dag las so //
translated: It is made of the five meats.

original: rgyud 'dir gsungs kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir gsungs kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this Tantra means in the Hevajra Tantra.

original: tshad ni nye bar mtshon pa ste cho ga yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ni nye bar mtshon pa ste cho ga yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The size is an illustration, and the ritual should be understood.

original: de bas na tshad la sogs pa 'dir rdzogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na tshad la sogs pa 'dir rdzogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the size and so forth are taught here in full.

original: kun tu sbas zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan du thams cad rdzogs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbas zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan du thams cad rdzogs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Completely hidden means that everything is taught in full in another Tantra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The great result and so forth are taught.

original: rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu chen por shes par bya ste /🔽phung po lnga po ye shes lngas bsgos shing ce spyang gi yan lag mchog kha sbyor gyi snod du gnas pa'i dba' po dang mnyam par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu chen por shes par bya ste / phung po lnga po ye shes lngas bsgos shing ce spyang gi yan lag mchog kha sbyor gyi snod du gnas pa'i dba' po dang mnyam par rtogs pas so //
translated: Having realized should be understood as the great result.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having realized that the five aggregates are suffused with the five pristine awarenesses, and that they are equal to the hero who abides in the vessel of the supreme limbs of the jackal in union, one should then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu'o //
translated: Then means after that.

original: rgyud 'dir sgrub pa'i thabs 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir sgrub pa'i thabs 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The method of practice in this tantra means

original: sgrub pa'i thabs kyi lam gang gis bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa sgrub cing mnyes par byed par gyur pa'i skabs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs kyi lam gang gis bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa sgrub cing mnyes par byed par gyur pa'i skabs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the occasion of the method of practice by which the Bhagavān together with the maṇḍala is accomplished and pleased.

original: padma bsam @196b bya ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems snang ba med par bsgoms pas 'gro ba rnams nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid du byas te /
analyzed: padma bsam @196b bya ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems snang ba med par bsgoms pas 'gro ba rnams nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid du byas te /
translated: The lotus is the bodhicitta, which is meditated on as nonappearance, making beings equal to space.

original: rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi bsams nas phyogs mtshams rnams su 'jigs par byed pa'i dur khrod brgyad bltas la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi bsams nas phyogs mtshams rnams su 'jigs par byed pa'i dur khrod brgyad bltas la /
translated: Having imagined the ground to be of vajra-nature, one should visualize the eight terrifying charnel grounds in the cardinal and intermediate directions.

original: de'i dbus su khang bu brtsegs pa'i nang du chud pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'am bzhi ba bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su khang bu brtsegs pa'i nang du chud pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'am bzhi ba bsam pa'o //
translated: In the middle of those, one should imagine an eight- or four-petaled lotus contained within a tiered house.

original: kha dog dmar po kun 'od ces bya ba ni mdog dmar zhing 'od dmar po dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dmar po kun 'od ces bya ba ni mdog dmar zhing 'od dmar po dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The red-colored one with light is red in color and has red light.

original: yid kyis zhes bya ba ni dpa' bor grags pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyis zhes bya ba ni dpa' bor grags pa ste /
translated: The mind is the one renowned as the hero.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i yid kyi thig le padma'i karni kar gnas pa las phyogs bzhi'i 'dab ma rnams su yang spros pas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i yid kyi thig le padma'i karni kar gnas pa las phyogs bzhi'i 'dab ma rnams su yang spros pas mtshan pa'o //
translated: From the extremely pure mind drop located in the karnikara of the lotus, one should imagine the four petals in the cardinal directions marked with emanations.

original: lha mo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: lha mo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with the four goddesses.

original: zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams kyi thig le rnams las go rims bzhin du rdo rje dang / nor bu dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs kyi dbang po mtha' yas pa'i rigs dang bcas par so sor mtha' yas pa'i phyogs su spros te de dag bsdus pa las byung ba'i rdo rje dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams kyi thig le rnams las go rims bzhin du rdo rje dang / nor bu dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs kyi dbang po mtha' yas pa'i rigs dang bcas par so sor mtha' yas pa'i phyogs su spros te de dag bsdus pa las byung ba'i rdo rje dang /
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with “in the east” is that the bindus of the petals in the east and so on emanate the lords of the vajra, jewel, lotus, and action families, respectively, together with their infinite families, in the infinite directions.

original: rin po che dang / padma dang / sna tshogs mkha' 'gro ma rnams 'dab ma de rnams kyi gdan la bkod pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che dang / padma dang / sna tshogs mkha' 'gro ma rnams 'dab ma de rnams kyi gdan la bkod pa'o //
translated: Those bindus are gathered and become the vajra, jewel, lotus, and dakini seats of the respective families.

original: sangs rgyas gzugs kyis nyer brgyan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs kyis nyer brgyan pa //
translated: Adorned with the forms of the buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with “buddhas” is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The buddhas are the vajra holders.

original: gzugs ni dpal he ru ka'i sku ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni dpal he ru ka'i sku ste /
translated: The forms are the bodies of the glorious Herukas.

original: de dkyil 'khor gyi bdag por gyur pas nye bar brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de dkyil 'khor gyi bdag por gyur pas nye bar brgyan pa'o //
translated: They are the masters of the mandala and are the adornments.

original: de yang lha mo de rnams kyis rtsa ba'i yid kyis thig le la 'og nas 'byung ba'i glus bskul bar gyur pas sa bon gnyis kyi rnam par gyur pa la de las rigs lnga'i dbang po de'i rigs rnams phyogs mtshams rnams su khyab par spros te /
analyzed: de yang lha mo de rnams kyis rtsa ba'i yid kyis thig le la 'og nas 'byung ba'i glus bskul bar gyur pas sa bon gnyis kyi rnam par gyur pa la de las rigs lnga'i dbang po de'i rigs rnams phyogs mtshams rnams su khyab par spros te /
translated: Moreover, those goddesses, with their fundamental minds, urge the bindu with the song that will occur below, which transforms into the form of the two seed syllables. From that, the lords of the five families emanate in the directions and intermediate directions.

original: de rnams yang dag par bsdus pa'i sa bon gnyis po yongs su gyur pa las sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro mas yongs su 'khyud pa'i dpal he ru kas nye bar brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams yang dag par bsdus pa'i sa bon gnyis po yongs su gyur pa las sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro mas yongs su 'khyud pa'i dpal he ru kas nye bar brgyan pa'o //
translated: Those are completely gathered into the two seed syllables, which transform completely into Śrī Heruka, embraced by Buddha dakini, and adorned by the heroes.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzugs ci 'dra ba zhig gis she na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzugs ci 'dra ba zhig gis she na /
translated: In what way is he like a buddha?

original: shar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is said to have four faces, and so on.

analyzed: zhal bzhi zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhir bstan pa'i zhal bzhi'o //
translated: “Four faces” are the four faces that are shown in the four directions.

original: phyag bzhi dang spyan gsum ni go sla'o //
analyzed: phyag bzhi dang spyan gsum ni go sla'o //
translated: “Four arms” and “three eyes” are easy to understand.

original: zhal gang gi mdog gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhal gang gi mdog gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the color of each face,

original: shar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @197a * //

translated: “in the east” and so on is said.

analyzed: te ; shar phyogs kyi zhal ni autpala sngon po'i mdog go //
translated: The face in the east is the color of a blue lotus.

original: lho phyogs kyi zhal ni ser po'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi zhal ni ser po'o //
translated: The face in the south is yellow.

translated: The face in the west is white and red.

analyzed: rtsa ba'i zhal gyi mdog gang yin pa de nyid sku mdog kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa nyid do //
translated: The color of the principal face is the same as the color of the body. This is well known.

original: 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrigs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrigs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Surrounded by a garland of flames means

analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus kyi me lce'i phreng ba lta bu'i 'od kyis kun du 'khrigs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: that he is surrounded by light like the garland of flames of the fire at the end of the eon.

analyzed: phyag g-yon na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lha mo rnams kyi mtshan ma gsungs pa ste /
translated: The goddesses' emblems are mentioned beginning with In the left hands...

analyzed: 'di'i phyag g-yon na kha t'am ga dang dril bu yod pas na phyag g-yon na kha tv'am ga dang dril bu'o //
translated: He is called holding a khaṭvāṅga and a ghanta in the left hands because he holds a khaṭvāṅga and a ghanta in the left hands.

analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje dang thod pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, vajra and skull-cups means🔽that he holds a vajra and skull-cups in the left hands.

analyzed: rdo rje dang thod pa dag 'di'i phyag g-yas na mnga' bas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called Vajra and Skull-bearer because he holds a vajra and a skull-cup in his right hands.

analyzed: shar phyogs zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs kyi 'dab ma'i'o //

analyzed: lha mo zhes bya ba ni byang phyogs la sogs pa'i bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'dir dang por dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, beginning with Sri Vajradaka,

translated: in order, the Jewel Dakini, the Lotus Dakini, and the Diverse Dakini are in the north.

analyzed: mdung rtse gsum dang / rin po che dang / ba dan dang / ce byang rnams 'di'i phyag na mnga' bas de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: cho ga'i thabs sna tshogs ni las rgyas pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The “various methods of ritual” are the extensive rites, and so forth.

original: dman pa'i dngos grub la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i dngos grub la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “inferior powers” are the powers of the lower vehicles, and so forth.

original: bstan pa ni de dag thams cad bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni de dag thams cad bshad pa'o //
translated: “Teaching” is explaining all of those.

original: 'di dag thams cad ci'i phyir byas she na /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ci'i phyir byas she na /
translated: Why is all of this done?

original: lha mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lha mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “the goddess’s mind,” and so forth.

original: lha mo ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo'o //
analyzed: lha mo ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo'o //
translated: The “goddess” is Mahāmāya.

original: de'i yid la 'dod pa ni thugs su byon pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yid la 'dod pa ni thugs su byon pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: “What is desired by her mind” is what is approved by her mind.

original: de'i phyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught.

original: rgyud yongs su 'dzin pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su 'dzin pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the benefit of holding the tantra,

original: gang gi khyim du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi khyim du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares the verse beginning with “In whose house.”

original: gang gi khyim ni gang zhig gi khyim du'o //
analyzed: gang gi khyim ni gang zhig gi khyim du'o //
translated: In whose house means in whose home.

original: rgyud ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo zhes grags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud ni sgyu 'phrul chen mo zhes grags pa'o //
translated: The tantra is the one known as the Great Illusion.

original: rtag tu gnas shing zhes bya ba ni rtag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas shing zhes bya ba ni rtag par gnas pa'o //
translated: Always dwelling means always present.

original: 'chang ba zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Holding means grasping.

original: klog pa ni gus par 'don pa'o //
analyzed: klog pa ni gus par 'don pa'o //
translated: Reciting means reciting with devotion.

original: rnam pa bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'o //
translated: Meditating means making it into a meditative stabilization.

original: bgegs ni bgegs rnams so //
analyzed: bgegs ni bgegs rnams so //
translated: Obstructions are the obstructors.

original: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma yang de yin la chen mo yang de dag yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma yang de yin la chen mo yang de dag yin no //
translated: They are also Vajrayoginis, and they are also great.

original: dgongs pa ni de dag gis yongs su bzung ba'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni de dag gis yongs su bzung ba'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The intention is the conclusion that they hold.

original: rnam 'byor ma'i rgyud mtha' dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam 'byor ma'i rgyud mtha' dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the entire Yoginī Tantra is the meaning of the entire Yoginī Tantra.

original: gsang ba ni de'i snying pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni de'i snying pa'o //
translated: The secret is its essence.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: gsang ba chen po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsang ba chen po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The great secret is the name of the first chapter of the tantra.

original: rgyud kyi dang po ni mchog tu gsang ba zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rgyud kyi dang po ni mchog tu gsang ba zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: The supreme secret is the name of the first chapter of the tantra.

original: mthar ni gsang ba chen po'o zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mthar ni gsang ba chen po'o zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The great secret is the name of the last chapter of the tantra.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen mo zhes bya bar grags pa'i rgyud do //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen mo zhes bya bar grags pa'i rgyud do //
translated: The great illusion is the name of the tantra.

original: nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The together with the enjoyments is the name of the tantra.

original: bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga ni nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga ni nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The enjoyments are the ritual means of accomplishing the object of attainment.

original: de dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa ni nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa ni nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa ste //
translated: The together with the enjoyments is the tantra that engages together with that.

original: des stong pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des stong pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of not empty is by that.

original: rdzogs pa ni de mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni de mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The perfected is the culmination of that.

original: de ltar bdag gis sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i rgyud kyi 'grel pa yon tan ldan byas pas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i rgyud kyi 'grel pa yon tan ldan byas pas /
translated: Thus, by me, having composed the commentary on the great illusion tantra endowed with good qualities,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i ri bong can ltar mdzes pa'i bsod nams thob pa gang yin pas //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i ri bong can ltar mdzes pa'i bsod nams thob pa gang yin pas //
translated: whatever merit is obtained, beautiful like the full moon,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi bdag nyid gcig po rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du bdag gyur nas //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi bdag nyid gcig po rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du bdag gyur nas //
translated: Having become the one nature of the Victorious Ones, the Vajra Holder himself,🔽may I attain the end of all the unbearable suffering of beings.

original: de yis skye bo rnams kyi sdug bsngal mi bzad ma lus zad pa rnyed par shog / rin chen 'byung gnas de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @201a * //
analyzed: de yis skye bo rnams kyi sdug bsngal mi bzad ma lus zad pa rnyed par shog / rin chen 'byung gnas de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @201a * //
translated: That source of jewels, the perfect Buddha,

original: sras bcas rnams kyis nges par byin brlabs pas //
analyzed: sras bcas rnams kyis nges par byin brlabs pas //
translated: is certainly blessed by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de yi sku gsung thugs kyi 'jug pa rnams ni nges par 'gro ba rnams la phan phyir yin //
analyzed: de yi sku gsung thugs kyi 'jug pa rnams ni nges par 'gro ba rnams la phan phyir yin //
translated: His activities of body, speech, and mind are certainly for the benefit of beings.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen mo zhes bya'i rgyud mchog tshig don rtogs dkar sbyar bas dka' ba gang yin pa'i //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen mo zhes bya'i rgyud mchog tshig don rtogs dkar sbyar bas dka' ba gang yin pa'i //
translated: This excellent tantra called the Great Magical Emanation, whose words and meaning are difficult to understand,

original: 'grel pa yon tan ldan pa 'di ni mu tig phreng ltar skye bo'i snying ni 'gugs byed yin //
analyzed: 'grel pa yon tan ldan pa 'di ni mu tig phreng ltar skye bo'i snying ni 'gugs byed yin //
translated: is like a pearl necklace that attracts the hearts of people with this commentary that possesses good qualities.

original: dpal sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i 'grel pa yon tan ldan pa las nges par bstan pa gsum pa'o /
analyzed: dpal sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i 'grel pa yon tan ldan pa las nges par bstan pa gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter of the commentary on the qualities of the glorious Great Magical Emanation, the teaching on the three.

original: // / dpal sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i 'grel pa yon tan ldan pa zhes bya ba slob dpon pandi ta chen po dpal rin chen 'byung gnas zhi ba'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / dpal sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i 'grel pa yon tan ldan pa zhes bya ba slob dpon pandi ta chen po dpal rin chen 'byung gnas zhi ba'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the glorious Great Illusion, called “Possessing Good Qualities,” composed by the great master, the glorious Ratnakarashanti, is complete.

original: // / pandi ta chen po zhi ba bzang po dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba 'gos lhas btsas kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / pandi ta chen po zhi ba bzang po dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba 'gos lhas btsas kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
